meanings.definition: Early symptoms or signs of a disease.
meanings.sent1: The prodromata of the flu include fatigue and body aches.
meanings.sent2: Doctors look for prodromata to diagnose illnesses early.
meanings.sent3: The prodromata of a cold can sometimes be mistaken for allergies.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden cough was the prodromata of the impending flu season.
meanings.sent5: Recognizing the prodromata of a migraine can help prevent a full-blown attack.

meanings.definition: A precursor or warning sign of something.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were the prodromata of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His sudden silence was a prodromata of his anger.
meanings.sent3: The prodromata of a busy day are usually a full inbox and a long to-do list.
meanings.sent4: The first drops of rain were the prodromata of the monsoon season.
meanings.sent5: The early morning traffic jam was a clear prodromata of a hectic day ahead.
